results.title: Identifying Fire Hazards
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Safetycare”.
Identifying potential fire hazards is an extension of a basic good housekeeping policy - preventing fires by identifying and removing potential fire hazards should be regular practice in all workplaces. This video tells what to look for to make sure safety precautions such as fire doors are functioning properly and will serve their intended purpose in an emergency. Sprinklers, safe storage, controlling incoming goods, proper ventilation are some of the points.

results.title: Identifying and dealing with job burnout: trainers manual [text]
results.brief_description: The trainer’s manual to accompany the program of the same title and offers a transcript of the dramatised situation with discussion topics addressing identifying the symptoms of job burnout and appropriate strategies to overcome these. Various self-assessment exercises will enable the user to evaluate their own levels of job burnout and to personalise an action plan to deal with it. The video tape may be borrowed as a separate loan item.

results.title: Identifying and dealing with job burnout
results.brief_description: Job burnout is a serious problem. It can not only destroy a career, but affect relationships, personal health and self-esteem. This program presents a dramatisation which identifies the symptoms of job burnout, examines possible causes and offers several key strategies which will assist in reducing the effects. Introduces the SPACE strategy involving Social supports, Powerful thoughts, Autonomy, Confronting your stress and Extending your skills. Accompanied by a training manual which may be borrowed as a separate loan item.

results.title: Identification of a woman = Identificazione di una donna
results.creator_credit: Lynn Kamern, IterFilm, Gaumont-British Instructional and Michelangelo Antonioni
results.brief_description: Niccolo (Thomas Milan) needs a female for his next film project, but his ideas for both project and protagonist are somewhat vague. As his relationship with his girlfriend dissolves - she leaves him to move in with another woman, - he embarks on an affair with a young actress, but she, too, eventually eludes him. Perhaps Antonioni’s most beautiful film, this is not only the story of Niccolo’s search for his ideal woman, it is the search for his own identity which drives this film to its poignant conclusion. In Italian with English subtitles.

results.title: Ideas of their own
results.creator_credit: Eileen Molony, George Inger and BBC-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Springs of learning”.
The most significant development of the child in his third year is his use of language. His mother can help him greatly by talking and listening to him, reading stories and nursery rhymes and sharing picture books. At this age a child develops an increased sense of his own identity, words such as ‘you’ and ‘I’, ‘yours’ and ‘mine’ take on meaning.

results.title: Ideas for you
results.creator_credit: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Joe Scully
results.brief_description: Productivity ideas are vital to progress in Australian industry. Productivity groups of twelve or more meet regularly to exchange ideas. A new method of coating earth moving equipment, new fixing cement, a shortened cycle in washing machines, an insulated container for freighting dry ice, and a new method of packing poultry, are some results of the group’s activities.

results.title: Ideas at work
results.brief_description: This film demonstrates how skilled workers may be freed from unnecessary labour by the use of simple mechanical devices and for rearrangement of personnel. As the result of employee suggestions for improvements, labour and time saving devices are adopted, leading to increased production. Such increased productivity can lead to shorter hours and higher wages.

results.title: Ida makes a movie
results.creator_credit: Linda Schuyler, Learning Corporation of America and Kit Hood
results.brief_description: Ida decides to make a film about garbage and enter it in a children’s filmmaking festival. She receives a notice that her film has been selected as a finalist, but the jury has decided that Ida’s film is about war. She is in a dilemma - should she tell the awards committee the truth or remain silent? She decides to go to the awards and take her chances. When she wins first prize she steps forward and tells the audience and the judges the true story. Truth and Ida both win.

results.title: ICRC 1983
results.creator_credit: International Committee of the Red Cross
results.brief_description: Provides an overview of the work that was carried out world wide by the Red Cross in 1983. Shows volunteers and delegates at work in Africa, Poland, Middle East, Thailand, South America and Granada.

results.title: Icon
results.brief_description: A comedy about the gender of god and the real wishes of the Virgin Mary. Hugely successful, this one minute short has screened at festivals throughout Australia and Europe, and at the United Women’s Conference in Beijing.
